Do you know what were you doing when this error occurred? Where did you find this error? Did an error dialog popup or were you just looking in your workspace's .metadata/.log file? Can you provide more context?

I'm also have this bug on Windows XP Professional.
I've break it down to the following scenario. Run a background job that ends unsuccessful. Now you have a icon within the statebar that indicates a background-job end unsuccessful and you can click this icon to open the problems-view. And this doesn't work sometimes because the exception above was thrown.
No error-dialog wars raised. Only a entry in the log-view and the log-file were generated.
I just got this too.  I can confirm that it's caused when clicking on the error icon in the progress trim.
I'm on Windows, so I've changed the OS to All.
This looks like an error in the StatusManager. Szymon have you seen anything like this?

I have just run this in I20071010 and I cannot replicate.

Here are my steps

1) Load org.eclipse.ui.examples.job from the repository
2) Select Fail and No Prompt in the Job Factory view
3) Run - you will get the icon
4) Select the icon 
5) You get the dialog as expected

Dirk I am confused about where you say it opens the problems view - do you mean progress view? And do you remember what action called the error?
I have also tried this in 3.3.1 and 3.3.0 and can't replicate.
